abstract: Did anyone seriously believe that videos like Baby Einstein were anything other than a feel-good form of electronic baby-sitting?
snippet: Did anyone seriously believe that videos like Baby Einstein were anything other than a feel-good form of electronic baby-sitting?
lead_paragraph: Toddlers and TV is a subject that just won't go away. KJ DellAntonia wrote about it here just last week, and this week a new recommendation issued by the American Academy of Pediatrics at the group's annual meeting in Boston has revived it again. The pediatricians said that parents should limit the amount of time their infants and toddlers spend in front of any sort of screen and reaffirmed earlier research showing that there's really no such thing as educational TV or software for very young children.

headline.main: The Real Problem With Toddlers and TV
